Ko- fi

Support me on Patreon!

Jackz | 22 | Leo ♌ | INTJ | Freelance Mexican artist

Commissions: Open.

Hey, this is my art blog. I post fanart and my OC's every now and then.

I track #jackzarts, if you wanna show me something.

These are the tags for my art: #drawings and #sketches

I use Photoshop CS6 for my Illustrations and Toon Boom Harmony for my animations

summary: Usually Ookami bends down to let Tamara kiss him but this time Tam has decided to try and reach him herself. Standing on her tip...
caption:
Usually Ookami bends down to let Tamara kiss him but this time Tam has decided to try and reach him herself. Standing on her tip toes she was able to give him a quick kiss before landing back down on her feet.

Ships with a height difference one of my weakness


This picture has oc x canon stuff in it so if that is not your cup of tea then leave.

blog.name: kingdomofkitten
blog.title: Jacob A.K.A. KingdomOfKitten
blog.description:
I write sometimes. I think that says a lot about my career choices.

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/KingdomOfKitten

My Letterboxd: https://letterboxd.com/kingdomofkitten/

title: Meeting The Families: Part 4
body:
Rie: *trying to feed Ikari* Come, now, sweetheart, let grandma fill your tummy.

Ikari: *hesitating* Ehhh! >_<

Rie: *sigh* This is going nowhere.

Hiroko: Here, lemme try! *Rie hands her the plastic spoon* Ah, c’mon, buddy! Don’t ya want some baby food from yer auntie? :D

Ikari: *still turning away*

Hiroko: …..okay, I guess not. *Haida runs in* Bro, you got one picky kid.

Haida: You don’t know the half of it. *to Rie* Hey, listen, can I talk to you, for a minute?

Rie: ….well, sure, what’s wrong?

Haida: *looking around* Is Retsuko nearby?

Hiroko: No, she went with mom and dad, to go grocery shopping.

Haida: Alright. I guess….can it be private?

Rie: Absolutely! Come on. *they head off to another room*

Hiroko: …..you’re gonna get fed, one way, or another.

Ikari: Bwah!

*meanwhile….*

Rie: So! What would you like to discuss, Haida?

Haida: ….um….earlier, I was trying to talk to Ryota, about the wedding, and-

Rie: *sigh* Let me guess, he still wasn’t budging?

Haida: ….well, yeah.

Rie: Figured. Listen, I will try my hardest to turn him around, but he’s stubborn to no end.

Haida: ….well, actually, that wasn’t all. He kinda just implied she had….a history? And that her rage thing wasn’t a good thing?

Rie: ….no…..he didn’t. HE DIDN’T SAY THAT. TELL ME YOU’RE JUST JOKING WITH ME, HAIDA!

Haida: …..I’m….not?

Rie: …..aaargh, DAMMIT! *slams her fist on a table* I knew he would spill the secret one of these days!

Haida: …wh….what do you mean?

Rie: ….*sigh* here. *she hands Haida an old picture of the family, in her pocket, with slightly younger Ryota and Rie, a pre-teen Retsuko, toddler Riko and Ryuu, and an elderly…*

Haida: …Ryoko.

Rie: I’m supposing Ryota told you about her?

Haida: ….all he told me was that she was a lot like Retsuko, down to the rage.

Rie: Figured. It’s not a story he finds it necessary to tell…but I do. Haida, Retsuko is indeed a wonderful girl. And I am overjoyed she found someone like you as her fiancee. But with that, you need to understand that, there’s some heavy baggage that comes with it.

Haida: ….what do you mean?

Rie: …it happened back when Retsuko was around…13, I believe. It was a stormy night. At that time, Retsuko was quite the studious one, but she was a pre-teen girl, understand. She had her own personal interests growing, and it was conflicting with our own interests. She had become interested in some boy, the name escapes me at the moment, and….well, outside of Ryoko, none of us were particularly supportive of her. “Oh, you’re too young, that goes against the code of this family,” and so on, and so on.

Haida: Yeah?

Rie: ….she….she didn’t take it well. I forget what set it off, but it was primarily a specific argument with Ryota, that ended with her grounded….that was when the rage kicked in. W-we had seen it before, but somehow, it was stronger than we ever expected. Within the span of about two minutes, she had taken out almost 80% of the house. With the storm, it got even bigger, and the danger for everyone became immense. Ryoko….oh, bless her. She took the method of “fighting fire with fire.:

Haida: ….o-oh.

Rie: Yes. Ryota tried to take her down with simple straining methods, but it never worked. We were worried Retsuko would start attacking the town, so, Ryoko unleashed her rage, and the two battled. It took about 15 minutes, but eventually Retsuko passed out, and fell…..unfortunately, Ryoko fell too.

Haida: ….”unfortunately”?

Rie: ….*sigh* all the energy from her was put into that fight, and once it was done, she had her final breaths….hmm, it’s interesting. She loved Retsuko. More than I think anyone in this family ever did….and when she fought her…I don’t know if the thought of attacking her was so devastating, she didn’t want to keep going in life, or that she was willing to sacrifice her own life, just to protect her granddaughter…

Haida: …oh….I-I’m so sorry.

Rie: It’s fine…it’s old news, anyway….in any case, we hid that story from Retsuko, as much as we could. She only remembers she got mad. Nothing more. The house, we just said the storm took it down. Ryoko, we said she died peacefully in her sleep. The latter made Retsuko very upset, but at least she never had the guilt haunt her.

Haida: …oh god…

Rie: Since then, Ryota had been especially stoic, and strict in the household. And Retsuko….by our own ways, she became much less carefree, and more….for a lack of a better word, respectable. Not that she wasn’t before, but it was especially prevalent.

Haida: …truthfully, she is always like that, at our workplace.

Rie: I see……we hadn’t seen that rage come back since…have you?

Haida: She mainly keeps it private, but yes, I’ve seen it. Mostly whenever we go to karaoke, and she plays death metal.

Rie: Huh. *smirks* I guess that was something that was never going to change!

Haida: Yeah…you think she needs to know?

Rie: *sigh* She might…but until then, she seems happy enough, so that’s how it’ll probably always be.

Haida: Alright. *the two start to walk out, unaware of who’s in front of them*

Rie: I’ll tell you something, though. There have only been two times, I can think of, when my husband cried. The first was when Retsuko was born, and the second was the night…*sees who just saw them*…Ryoko died…

Haida: What, what’s wro-*sees who it is*….oh, god…

*it’s Retsuko, with a thousand yard stare, trembling, her mouth agape*

Rie: …w-welcome back, sweetheart! I suppose you got everything you ne-

Retsuko: So THAT’S why she died?! I killed her?! AND YOU NEVER TOLD ME?!

Rie: ….h-how much have you hear-

Retsuko: THE WHOLE THING! YOU LIED TO ME!

Rie: It was for your own good, Retsuko!

Retsuko: Mine, or yours?! *runs off, with a sudden hint of death metal permeating her* WHERE’S DAD?!

Rie: *follows her* Retsuko, wait!

Haida: *follows suit* Come back!

*all when this happened…*

Harumi: *she and Hisoka were standing right beside Retsuko when this transpired* ….

Hisoka: ….

Harumi: …..well, I guess we have to unload all the groceries.

Hisoka: Indeed….you know, aside from that inner demon battle murder thing, I really like her! :)

Harumi: Me too! Very nice girl.

*meanwhile, outside, Ryota is teaching Ryuu and Riko kendo, as Retsuko storms over to him, under a dark gray sky*

Retsuko: THERE YOU ARE.

Ryota: ….what are you wanting, Retsuko?

Retsuko: ANSWERS, DAMMIT, ANSWERS.

Ryota: Answers to what? My refusal to partake in your little farce, or-

Retsuko: NONE OF THAT BULLSHIT, I’M TALKING ABOUT GRANDMA. DID I KILL HER?!

Ryota: …h-how did yo-

Rie: She knows! Haida asked me, I told him the story, and she overheard it!

Ryota: YOU told him?!

Rie: Only after YOU hinted it at him!

Retsuko: IT DOESN’T MATTER! WHY DID YOU HIDE IT?! WHY DID YOU MAKE ME HIDE ALL OF THAT IN ME?! WHY DID YOU TURN ME INTO SOMETHING I NEVER WAS?! MAKING ME CRY MYSELF TO SLEEP AT NIGHT, WORRIED THAT I WOULD NEVER GET YOUR APPROVALS?! YOU DON’T HAVE A CLUE HOW MUCH YOU HURT ME THROUGHOUT THE YEARS! AND NOW, YOU WILL PAY.

Ryota: …..Ryuu, Riko, go to your mother.

Riko: Wha-

Ryota: GO!

Ryuu: *he and Riko run behind Rie* What the hell is going on?!

Rie: I-I don’t know…

Haida: …it’s gonna be bad.

Ryota: ….so. You want answers? You want answers to why we hid those horrific demons in you, for the sake of you, and for everyone else in this family? You want to know why we never told you why, yes, you DID kill her, and why I never was able to look at you the same way ever again? *a familiar aura starts surrounding him* Hmmph. Alright. And perhaps you’re right. I have no clue how much we hurt you. Much like how you don’t know how much you hurt us. Especially me. But don’t you worry, I’ll answer everything you asked of me. And as for me paying….well…..*he turns into a similar demonic rage face* HERE’S MY PAYMENT.

Haida: ….”unfortunately”?

Rie: ….*sigh* all the energy from her was put into that fight, and once it was done, she had her final breaths….hmm, it’s interesting. She loved Retsuko. More than I think anyone in this family ever did….and when she fought her…I don’t know if the thought of attacking her was so devastating, she didn’t want to keep going in life, or that she was willing to sacrifice her own life, just to protect her granddaughter…

Haida: …oh….I-I’m so sorry.

Rie: It’s fine…it’s old news, anyway….in any case, we hid that story from Retsuko, as much as we could. She only remembers she got mad. Nothing more. The house, we just said the storm took it down. Ryoko, we said she died peacefully in her sleep. The latter made Retsuko very upset, but at least she never had the guilt haunt her.

Haida: …oh god…

Rie: Since then, Ryota had been especially stoic, and strict in the household. And Retsuko….by our own ways, she became much less carefree, and more….for a lack of a better word, respectable. Not that she wasn’t before, but it was especially prevalent.

Haida: …truthfully, she is always like that, at our workplace.

Rie: I see……we hadn’t seen that rage come back since…have you?

Haida: She mainly keeps it private, but yes, I’ve seen it. Mostly whenever we go to karaoke, and she plays death metal.

Rie: Huh. *smirks* I guess that was something that was never going to change!

Haida: Yeah…you think she needs to know?

Rie: *sigh* She might…but until then, she seems happy enough, so that’s how it’ll probably always be.

Haida: Alright. *the two start to walk out, unaware of who’s in front of them*

Rie: I’ll tell you something, though. There have only been two times, I can think of, when my husband cried. The first was when Retsuko was born, and the second was the night…*sees who just saw them*…Ryoko died…

Haida: What, what’s wro-*sees who it is*….oh, god…

*it’s Retsuko, with a thousand yard stare, trembling, her mouth agape*

Rie: …w-welcome back, sweetheart! I suppose you got everything you ne-

Retsuko: So THAT’S why she died?! I killed her?! AND YOU NEVER TOLD ME?!

Rie: ….h-how much have you hear-

Retsuko: THE WHOLE THING! YOU LIED TO ME!

Rie: It was for your own good, Retsuko!

Retsuko: Mine, or yours?! *runs off, with a sudden hint of death metal permeating her* WHERE’S DAD?!

Rie: *follows her* Retsuko, wait!

Haida: *follows suit* Come back!

*all when this happened…*

Harumi: *she and Hisoka were standing right beside Retsuko when this transpired* ….

Hisoka: ….

Harumi: …..well, I guess we have to unload all the groceries.

Hisoka: Indeed….you know, aside from that inner demon battle murder thing, I really like her! :)

Harumi: Me too! Very nice girl.

*meanwhile, outside, Ryota is teaching Ryuu and Riko kendo, as Retsuko storms over to him, under a dark gray sky*

Retsuko: THERE YOU ARE.

Ryota: ….what are you wanting, Retsuko?

Retsuko: ANSWERS, DAMMIT, ANSWERS.

Ryota: Answers to what? My refusal to partake in your little farce, or-

Retsuko: NONE OF THAT BULLSHIT, I’M TALKING ABOUT GRANDMA. DID I KILL HER?!

Ryota: …h-how did yo-

Rie: She knows! Haida asked me, I told him the story, and she overheard it!

Ryota: YOU told him?!

Rie: Only after YOU hinted it at him!

Retsuko: IT DOESN’T MATTER! WHY DID YOU HIDE IT?! WHY DID YOU MAKE ME HIDE ALL OF THAT IN ME?! WHY DID YOU TURN ME INTO SOMETHING I NEVER WAS?! MAKING ME CRY MYSELF TO SLEEP AT NIGHT, WORRIED THAT I WOULD NEVER GET YOUR APPROVALS?! YOU DON’T HAVE A CLUE HOW MUCH YOU HURT ME THROUGHOUT THE YEARS! AND NOW, YOU WILL PAY.

Ryota: …..Ryuu, Riko, go to your mother.

Riko: Wha-

Ryota: GO!

Ryuu: *he and Riko run behind Rie* What the hell is going on?!

Rie: I-I don’t know…

Haida: …it’s gonna be bad.

Ryota: ….so. You want answers? You want answers to why we hid those horrific demons in you, for the sake of you, and for everyone else in this family? You want to know why we never told you why, yes, you DID kill her, and why I never was able to look at you the same way ever again? *a familiar aura starts surrounding him* Hmmph. Alright. And perhaps you’re right. I have no clue how much we hurt you. Much like how you don’t know how much you hurt us. Especially me. But don’t you worry, I’ll answer everything you asked of me. And as for me paying….well…..*he turns into a similar demonic rage face* HERE’S MY PAYMENT.
trail.content:
Rie: *trying to feed Ikari* Come, now, sweetheart, let grandma fill your tummy.

Ikari: *hesitating* Ehhh! >_<

Rie: *sigh* This is going nowhere.

Hiroko: Here, lemme try! *Rie hands her the plastic spoon* Ah, c’mon, buddy! Don’t ya want some baby food from yer auntie? :D

Ikari: *still turning away*

Hiroko: …..okay, I guess not. *Haida runs in* Bro, you got one picky kid.

Haida: You don’t know the half of it. *to Rie* Hey, listen, can I talk to you, for a minute?

Rie: ….well, sure, what’s wrong?

Haida: *looking around* Is Retsuko nearby?

Hiroko: No, she went with mom and dad, to go grocery shopping.

Haida: Alright. I guess….can it be private?

Rie: Absolutely! Come on. *they head off to another room*

Hiroko: …..you’re gonna get fed, one way, or another.

Ikari: Bwah!

*meanwhile….*

Rie: So! What would you like to discuss, Haida?

Haida: ….um….earlier, I was trying to talk to Ryota, about the wedding, and-

Rie: *sigh* Let me guess, he still wasn’t budging?

Haida: ….well, yeah.

Rie: Figured. Listen, I will try my hardest to turn him around, but he’s stubborn to no end.

Haida: ….well, actually, that wasn’t all. He kinda just implied she had….a history? And that her rage thing wasn’t a good thing?

Rie: ….no…..he didn’t. HE DIDN’T SAY THAT. TELL ME YOU’RE JUST JOKING WITH ME, HAIDA!

Haida: …..I’m….not?

Rie: …..aaargh, DAMMIT! *slams her fist on a table* I knew he would spill the secret one of these days!

Haida: …wh….what do you mean?

Rie: ….*sigh* here. *she hands Haida an old picture of the family, in her pocket, with slightly younger Ryota and Rie, a pre-teen Retsuko, toddler Riko and Ryuu, and an elderly…*

Haida: …Ryoko.

Rie: I’m supposing Ryota told you about her?

Haida: ….all he told me was that she was a lot like Retsuko, down to the rage.

Rie: Figured. It’s not a story he finds it necessary to tell…but I do. Haida, Retsuko is indeed a wonderful girl. And I am overjoyed she found someone like you as her fiancee. But with that, you need to understand that, there’s some heavy baggage that comes with it.

Haida: ….what do you mean?

Rie: …it happened back when Retsuko was around…13, I believe. It was a stormy night. At that time, Retsuko was quite the studious one, but she was a pre-teen girl, understand. She had her own personal interests growing, and it was conflicting with our own interests. She had become interested in some boy, the name escapes me at the moment, and….well, outside of Ryoko, none of us were particularly supportive of her. “Oh, you’re too young, that goes against the code of this family,” and so on, and so on.

Haida: Yeah?

Rie: ….she….she didn’t take it well. I forget what set it off, but it was primarily a specific argument with Ryota, that ended with her grounded….that was when the rage kicked in. W-we had seen it before, but somehow, it was stronger than we ever expected. Within the span of about two minutes, she had taken out almost 80% of the house. With the storm, it got even bigger, and the danger for everyone became immense. Ryoko….oh, bless her. She took the method of “fighting fire with fire.:

Haida: ….o-oh.

Rie: Yes. Ryota tried to take her down with simple straining methods, but it never worked. We were worried Retsuko would start attacking the town, so, Ryoko unleashed her rage, and the two battled. It took about 15 minutes, but eventually Retsuko passed out, and fell…..unfortunately, Ryoko fell too.

Haida: ….”unfortunately”?

Rie: ….*sigh* all the energy from her was put into that fight, and once it was done, she had her final breaths….hmm, it’s interesting. She loved Retsuko. More than I think anyone in this family ever did….and when she fought her…I don’t know if the thought of attacking her was so devastating, she didn’t want to keep going in life, or that she was willing to sacrifice her own life, just to protect her granddaughter…

Haida: …oh….I-I’m so sorry.

Rie: It’s fine…it’s old news, anyway….in any case, we hid that story from Retsuko, as much as we could. She only remembers she got mad. Nothing more. The house, we just said the storm took it down. Ryoko, we said she died peacefully in her sleep. The latter made Retsuko very upset, but at least she never had the guilt haunt her.

Haida: …oh god…

Rie: Since then, Ryota had been especially stoic, and strict in the household. And Retsuko….by our own ways, she became much less carefree, and more….for a lack of a better word, respectable. Not that she wasn’t before, but it was especially prevalent.

Haida: …truthfully, she is always like that, at our workplace.

Rie: I see……we hadn’t seen that rage come back since…have you?

Haida: She mainly keeps it private, but yes, I’ve seen it. Mostly whenever we go to karaoke, and she plays death metal.

Rie: Huh. *smirks* I guess that was something that was never going to change!

Haida: Yeah…you think she needs to know?

Rie: *sigh* She might…but until then, she seems happy enough, so that’s how it’ll probably always be.

Haida: Alright. *the two start to walk out, unaware of who’s in front of them*

Rie: I’ll tell you something, though. There have only been two times, I can think of, when my husband cried. The first was when Retsuko was born, and the second was the night…*sees who just saw them*…Ryoko died…

Haida: What, what’s wro-*sees who it is*….oh, god…

*it’s Retsuko, with a thousand yard stare, trembling, her mouth agape*

Rie: …w-welcome back, sweetheart! I suppose you got everything you ne-

Retsuko: So THAT’S why she died?! I killed her?! AND YOU NEVER TOLD ME?!

Rie: ….h-how much have you hear-

Retsuko: THE WHOLE THING! YOU LIED TO ME!

Rie: It was for your own good, Retsuko!

Retsuko: Mine, or yours?! *runs off, with a sudden hint of death metal permeating her* WHERE’S DAD?!

Rie: *follows her* Retsuko, wait!

Haida: *follows suit* Come back!

*all when this happened…*

Harumi: *she and Hisoka were standing right beside Retsuko when this transpired* ….

Hisoka: ….

Harumi: …..well, I guess we have to unload all the groceries.

Hisoka: Indeed….you know, aside from that inner demon battle murder thing, I really like her! :)

Harumi: Me too! Very nice girl.

*meanwhile, outside, Ryota is teaching Ryuu and Riko kendo, as Retsuko storms over to him, under a dark gray sky*

Retsuko: THERE YOU ARE.

Ryota: ….what are you wanting, Retsuko?

Retsuko: ANSWERS, DAMMIT, ANSWERS.

Ryota: Answers to what? My refusal to partake in your little farce, or-

Retsuko: NONE OF THAT BULLSHIT, I’M TALKING ABOUT GRANDMA. DID I KILL HER?!

Ryota: …h-how did yo-

Rie: She knows! Haida asked me, I told him the story, and she overheard it!

Ryota: YOU told him?!

Rie: Only after YOU hinted it at him!

Retsuko: IT DOESN’T MATTER! WHY DID YOU HIDE IT?! WHY DID YOU MAKE ME HIDE ALL OF THAT IN ME?! WHY DID YOU TURN ME INTO SOMETHING I NEVER WAS?! MAKING ME CRY MYSELF TO SLEEP AT NIGHT, WORRIED THAT I WOULD NEVER GET YOUR APPROVALS?! YOU DON’T HAVE A CLUE HOW MUCH YOU HURT ME THROUGHOUT THE YEARS! AND NOW, YOU WILL PAY.

Ryota: …..Ryuu, Riko, go to your mother.

Riko: Wha-

Ryota: GO!

Ryuu: *he and Riko run behind Rie* What the hell is going on?!

Rie: I-I don’t know…

Haida: …it’s gonna be bad.

Ryota: ….so. You want answers? You want answers to why we hid those horrific demons in you, for the sake of you, and for everyone else in this family? You want to know why we never told you why, yes, you DID kill her, and why I never was able to look at you the same way ever again? *a familiar aura starts surrounding him* Hmmph. Alright. And perhaps you’re right. I have no clue how much we hurt you. Much like how you don’t know how much you hurt us. Especially me. But don’t you worry, I’ll answer everything you asked of me. And as for me paying….well…..*he turns into a similar demonic rage face* HERE’S MY PAYMENT.

summary:
This is a preview for the first in a series of mini fics centered around Haida and Retsukos relationship
On his way to the...
body:
This is a preview for the first in a series of mini fics centered around Haida and Retsukos relationship

On his way to the office one morning, Haida noticed Retsuko limping towards the office, holding a cup of tea in both hands.

“Hey Retsuko!” He called out, waving as held the door open for her.

“Hello Haida,” Retsuko said, barely managing to muster a smile.

“Is everything alright?” he asked. Usually Retsuko looked tired, but today was different. She was exhausted and he day hadn’t even started.

She sighed, looking past him. “I went on a date with someone from sales and I wore new heels.” she winced, and Haida noticed the blisters on her feet.

When Haida and Fenneko were on break, Retsuko got called away to do some more paperwork, undoubtedly others piling their problems onto her once more. When she left the room, Haida stood and walked to the window, staring at the skyline.

“Hey Fenneko, Retsuko really likes that guy from sales, right?” he asked.

“The Out of Pocket Prince?” Fenneko asked, not looking up from her phone.

“Yeah, him.” He sighed, recalling how exhausted Retsuko had looked lately. “I really want to punch that guy.”

summary: Me, writing part 3: Man, it took me weeks to write this damn thing! Hell, I don’t even know if it’s even that good! This damn...
body:
Me, writing part 3: Man, it took me weeks to write this damn thing! Hell, I don’t even know if it’s even that good! This damn arc is gonna kill me…I don’t even know if I will be able to finish the next one!

Me, writing part 4: *gets most of it done within the span of 10-15 minutes* …..huh. That looks nice so far. Alright, time for a break! *crashes onto the bed*

summary: I have no real clue what animal crossing is
body:
I have no real clue what animal crossing is

I’ve only known Isabelle for about 15 hours via Twitter and Tumblr

But I will protect her with my life

(a lot of this is because she reminds me of Aggretsuko)
